headline: Retail Earnings On Deck This Week: Home Depot, Walmart, Target
summary: Several big-box U.S. retailers are set to report second-quarter earnings this week, offering a glimpse into the spending habits of U.S. consumers and the continued impact of President Trump’s trade war.  Home Depot: The home-improvement chain is set to post earnings on Tuesday morning.  Earlier this year, Chief Financial Officer Richard McPhail said the company won’t raise prices in response to tariffs.

Earlier this year, Chief Financial Officer Richard McPhail said the company won’t raise prices in response to tariffs.

headline: US stocks waver, Jackson Hole, retailer earnings: 3 Things
summary: Here's what Wall Street is watching on Monday, Aug. 18. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) waver as investors gear up for a busy week with the Federal Reserve, geopolitical tensions, and retail earnings in focus. The market looks for signs about the Fed's next move with the Jackson Hole summit kicking off. Home Depot (HD), Lowe's (LOW), Walmart (WMT), and Target (TGT) report earnings this week, offering a look at the state of the consumer. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Putin, Earnings, Fed: 3 Things
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and his European allies are arriving in Washington today. they're anxious to find out what Donald Trump committed to at his summit with Vladimir Putin. They're also apprehensive that he’ll force Kyiv into making unpalatable concessions. Big box retailers will be in focus this week - the likes of Walmart (WMT), Target (TGT) and Home Depot (HD) all on deck. Jerome Powell also heads to Jackson Hole ahead of a keynote speech.
